opening_1: ^The Moon. The Earth. An iconic couple.
^... or so they were. Even legendary romances can start to struggle after 4.5 billion years.
^Earth was pretty focussed on itself. Moon was starting to feel neglected.
^Moon decided it was time for a change. Moon left earth's orbit and set out on a new adventure...
^Spiralling through the heavens and communing with the other celestials Moon heard about a special place where celestials can seek new love...
^This is the Moonshot Café. It is perhaps the best café in the solar system.
^Once a month they host a singles night especially for celestial bodies.
^Will Moon find a new romance here?
^Will this be the start of a wonderful new chapter, a new celestial alignment, an existential crisis for werewolves?
guide_1: ^Good evening planets, satellites and all other celestial bodies!
^I'm Fenrir, owner of the Moonshot Café and your host for the evening.
^Tonight is my favourite night of the month. It's Singles Night!
^I like to think of myself, indeed of my café, as a force majeure of matchmaking. I just love seeing you lovely celestials hitting it off. It sets my heart alight!
^More than a few stars have met their matches here. Some really big names.
^But I digress! Tonight isn't about them, or me.
^It's about you. I am here to help you find true love!
rules: ^Here's how this works. Pay close attention now!
^There will be three speed dating rounds. You'll be paired with three celestials. You'll have a few minutes to chat to each one.
^At the end of the night you'll find out who you hit it off with.
^You can then choose one of those lucky celestial bodies to go on a date with!
^Of course, you don't have to choose any of them if you don't want to. Single life is a beautiful thing.
^Did you get all that? Or would you like me to explain the rules again?
guide_2: ^Excellent! I'll take your orders, then we'll make a start.
